fort.name: Arakkoa Sanctuary (Lv1)
fort.description:
Units:
-10% HP
+5% evasion
+2 MP regeneration

Buildings:
-5% HP for Barracks
+100 attack range
Barracks have mana shield, instead of Repair

Upgrades:
+1Lv Magic

Traits: Arakkoa are humanoid avians ready to defend their territory no matter what the cost. Few have remained faithful to the light, most have harnessed the darkness and use it for cunning on the battlefield. The initial fighting weakness is compensated for by the fast recovery of buildings due to the mana shield, as well as very strong magic and tough units in the late game.

Difficulty: Expert
Created: by Ksay

fort.description:

+200 Arakkoa Sanctuary mana
+4 Arakkoa Sanctuary armor

fort.name: Arcane Sanctum (Lv1)
fort.description:
Units:
+5% evasion
-20% spell cooldown
-12% damage
-10% hit points

Buildings:
+12.5% mana

Upgrades:
+1Lv Magic

Traits: Glass cannons. Extremely weak starting units. Very fragile even in late game. Heavily relies on special upgrades inside towers. Delivers short outbursts of damage. Strong against buff dependent races.

Difficulty: Expert

fort.name: Chaos Citadel (Lv1)
fort.description:
Units:
+12% damage
+30% buy cost

Buildings:
+0.5 HP/sec regeneration

Upgrades:
+3Lv Building Damage

Traits: Extremely powerful with no real weaknesses. Demons reign in their realm virtually unchalanged. Luckily this is not their realm and keeping dimensional portals open for the supplylines is very expensive.

Difficulty: Beginer

fort.name: Chaos Citadel (Lv3)
fort.description:

fort.name: Dragon Keep (Lv1)
fort.description:
Units:
+5% attack rate

Buildings:
+20% damage
-5% cost
-12.5% mana

Upgrades:
-1Lv Magic
+10% research speed

Traits: Drakonid are mortals empowered by the dragons they serve. This faction is great in the early game but due to the lack of magic, it starts to lose heavily later on. Strong heroes that constantly increase their power are the key to dominating the map.

Difficulty: Advanced
Created: by Ksay

+2 armor

Traits: What they lack in magic and spells, Dwarves make it up in their ingenuity. Weak starting units, but powerful late game mechanical contraptions that are resistant to almost all magic effects.

Difficulty: Advanced

+5% attack rate

+5% attack rate

+3Lv Unit Armor

Traits: Jacks of all trades but masters of none. Very basic and simple, but versatile and adaptive. Good in every situation, foolproof and idiotfriendly. Easy to play and very boring. Recomended for total Noobs.

Difficulty: Beginer

kul.name: Admiralty of Kul'Tiras
description:
The Alliance - Admiralty of Kul'Tiras [R]
Units:
+2 armor

Buildings:
Improved main building Auras

Upgrades:
-5% cost
+1 start Amulet of Vitality level

Magic:
Tidal Weight (Slows enemy unit by 20%)
Water Bomb (Deals 150 dmg to a unit after 5s)
Tidal Burst (Deals 150 damage in 200 AoE)

Traits: Kul'Tiras is deeply connected with the sea, so even in ground battles they rely on their knowledge of sea power. Admiralty is akin to a wave, the more power they gain against their foes, the higher they will rise

Difficulty: Advanced
Created: by Snupi

heroes.description:
Hero Unit (Ranged)
Strong Vs All Units
Weak Vs Buildings

summons 2 Spirits for 60-90s
(100 second cooldown)

10-70% to spawn Skeleton Warrior on kill

fort.name: Corrupted Tree of Life (Lv1)
fort.description:
Units:
+10% spell resist
-10% hit points

Buildings:
+5% attack rate
+2 armor

Upgrades:
+3Lv Unit Damage

Traits: The power of demons has increased their resistance to magic, and the flesh of their enemies will fertilize the cursed forests in which they habit. Their strength is growing every minute, be afraid!

Difficulty: Expert

fort.name: Corrupted Tree of Life (Lv3)
fort.description:
Gives:
Can train Special Unit
+5500 Corrupted Tree of Life hit points
+200 Corrupted Tree of Life mana

fort.name: Chief's Hall (Lv1)
fort.description:
Units:
+15% hit points
-10% attack rate

Buildings:
+20% damage
-5% cost

Upgrades:
+3Lv Melee Weapons

Traits: Slow and steady wins the race! It is not about dealing damage, its about outliving enemy. Damage output rises slowly and peaks in late game. It depends on brute force and so cannot be denied or dispelled.

Difficulty: Advanced

fort.name: Chief's Hall (Lv3)
fort.description:

fort.name: Stronghold (Lv1)
fort.description:
Units:
+5% evasion
-5% hit points

Buildings:
+10% attack rate
+10% hit points

Upgrades:
+3Lv Ranged Weapons

Traits: Why so serious? Come and have a smoke with us! Fragile in early game, unpredictable in late game. Debilitates and confuses enemy. You won't win all games, but you will have fun in every single one.

Difficulty: Skilled

fort.name: Stronghold (Lv3)
fort.description:
Gives:
Can train Special Unit
+5500 Stronghold hit points
+200 Stronghold mana
+4 Stronghold armor

fort.name: Necropolis (Lv1)
fort.description:
Units:
-30% buy cost
-30% buy cooldown
-12% damage
-2 armor

Buildings:
+12.5% mana

Upgrades:
-5% cost

Traits: Quantity over quality. With the exception of a few dedicated damage sponges, most units are very weak and depend on high numbers rather than strength. Try to spawn them often.

Difficulty: Expert

fort.name: Necropolis (Lv3)
fort.description:
Gives:
Can train Special Unit
+5000 Necropolis hit points
+225 Necropolis mana
+4 Necropolis armor

fort.name: Vulpera Town (Lv1)
fort.description:
Units:
+5% damage
+5% evasion

Buildings:
+10% attack speed

Upgrades:
+3 Lv Ranged Weapons
Mana Stone's cost and MP given is halved

Traits: Vulpera are a race based on pace, if they can overtake opponents in strength and amount of gold, they will become a very serious opponent. Vulpera love to hoard gold and have plenty to spend it on. The troops, although not very strong, have many tricks to gain an advantage, especially defending the base and crushing the sidelines.

Difficulty: Advanced
Created: by Ksay
